intro: Morinda longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered morinda, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface. Morinda longifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
